intro: Wikstroemia grandis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Wikstroemia grandis is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays an important role in the ecological and cultural heritage of Hawaii.
